reviews.text: My wife & I met our friends from Epson Downs for a mid week break at this charming hotel. The staff were most welcoming & the food outstanding.....some of the best meals we have had for a long time. Our bedroom was delightful, the beds being very comfortable & with excellent pillows. A lovely place to meet up with old friends
reviews.title: A Most friendly Hotel

reviews.text: My husband only live about ten miles away but decided to stay over after dinner, taking advantage of the £85 bed and breakfast for 2 deal, which is phenomenal value. We were upgraded to a lovely room 'bohemia' and quaffed our complimentary half bottle of champagne. Dinner was delicious and service is good but not amazing. It lacked a little compared to the really slick operations like the Holbeck Ghyll where the wine is topped up without you noticing and they know what you ordered without asking, but it didn't spoil things. We were awoken by staff playing the guitar at 2am which was odd but no huge deal. We would go back and recommend to others.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Langar Hall is easy to find, nestling right next to the church in the middle of the village. The general feel of the place as we drove through the gates and parked under a row of overhanging trees was most welcoming. As we walked to Reception across the gravelled drive we stepped into a different world, one where doors were opened for us, a swift and friendly checkin and luggage carried for us. On the way to our room we were introduced to the facilities and communal rooms on the ground floor.
reviews.title: Another World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without exception, every staff member was happy, polite and efficient - nothing was too much trouble and there was nothing they couldn't organise for us. The rooms in this hotel are named after previous family occupants or for their purpose when the building was a private country house. We stayed in the Nursery, a light, airy room decorated with tasteful floral wallpaper, beautiful wood furniture and one of the most comfortable beds we have experienced. The bathroom, complete with both bath and shower, boasted a heated towel rail that could have warmed half the hotel. A cafatiere of coffee was consumed whilst relaxing in front of the log fire, where the resident cat joined us for a break.
reviews.title: Heaven in an English Vale

reviews.text: The occasion of dinner occurred in the Dining Room - it was so much more than a meal in a restaurant. I must admit the prices were a little more than we are used to paying, but it was well worth it and the food couln't be faulted - perfectly cooked and beautifully presented by the most discrete and attentive staff we have ever been served by. Our only disappointment was not having room to sample a pudding.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay - elegant but cosy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Langar Hall on route to a longer break elsewhere after recommendations by friends and were not disappointed. Although we were slightly apprehensive having read some of the reviews and in particular the rather forthright replies of the owner, we need not had been concerned. The hotel is rather eccentrically decorated in places but this together with the notes in the bedrooms written by the owner about the hotel and individual rooms makes one feel that you are staying in a private country house rather than a hotel. This individual approach was echoed by the warmth of the welcome and the care shown by the staff
reviews.title: A warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms were very comfortable, with good quality linen and beds, well decorated, in an individual style and well appointed. Not only were the bedrooms comfortable but also incredibly quiet. This coupled with a comfortable bed and curtains that excluded every shaft of light meant I had the best night’s sleep for some time.
reviews.title: The Definitive Small Country House Hotel

reviews.text: If there was one disappointment then it was to be found in the food. The cream tea on our first afternoon was good and the breakfast also (it would have been excellent had the orange juice been fresh) but the dinner on the one night we ate there was rather mixed. Your views on the quality of a meal can often be influenced by individual choices and simple bad luck. Although the quality of produce and presentation were excellent, the preparation left something to be desired. The starter of foie gras was the smallest by some way that I have ever had. The main course was one of those which on reading the menu you think that the chef must be a genius or trying too hard. Unfortunately it was the latter and I could almost hear the judges on Master Chef commenting on too many flavours on the plate. On the other hand my wife thought her meal was excellent and the cheese plate which I finished off with was everything the first two courses had not been – generous and well balanced.
reviews.title: Lovely place& food

reviews.text: Having said all of that the real question is would we stay there again? Having moved on the next day and stayed at a city centre hotel of a large chain I very quickly wished that we could have stayed longer at Langar. The answer is a very definite yes, we would stay there again and will be recommending it to friends.
reviews.title: Left feeling a little disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The moment you approach the faded ochre coloured house as you drive up the avenue lined with mature lime trees, you can almost sense that something special awaits within. The welcome from the reception staff was warm, friendly and efficient, and set the right tone for the rest of my stay.
reviews.title: Really Lovely - should be 5*

reviews.text: We stayed here for our works christmas party. Myself and a friend stayed in the Bohemia room which was decorated lovely, had lovely furniture. Would make for a good romantic room. It's a little dark in there though even with all the lights on so we were all bunched around the bathroom mirror trying to put our make up on.
reviews.title: lovely stay

reviews.text: The dinner we had was absolutely lovely, all of it was so tasty. The chocolate dessert i had was a bit rich though an after i'd had my starter (which was quite large) and my main it couldn't fit it in :( The staff we lovely from greeting us when we got there, guiding us to our rooms, making sure we had what we needed at dinner etc.
reviews.title: Amazing 10 years ago, Fantastic still....Langer Hall just gets better.

reviews.text: I'd love to come again with my partner so we can enjoy the surroundings as it looked like there was some nice grounds to walk around and also to have a look at langer as it seems a very pretty place to be.
reviews.title: A warm welcome

reviews.text: Imogen Skirving is a lovley lady and like her wines, she just gets better, a welcoming host and a real pleasure to meet, the recepition area has just been refurbed and is very tastfull, and the christmas decorations are better than ever, every year there is somthing new to look forward too- The food goes with outsaying-Fantastic.
reviews.title: Very good country hotel

reviews.text: We took our 9 year old daughter to show her where mum and dad got married 10 years ago, and she enjoyed the atmosphere as much as we did. Thank you -Imogen for another fab night.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read Snobs review and found it almost exactly what I wanted to write I will just like to add that we stayed in the Favourites room and had a similarly fabulous stay. The food, the welcoming staff, Imogen, the grounds, the house.... Everything and everyone is and was just perfect. In previous years we have visited Langar Hall for lunch, afternoon tea and dinner and have always been impressed by the gorgeous food and warm welcome. It is always brilliant. Don't pass up the chance to stay or eat here!
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Picked Langar Hall after good review in the Sunday Telegraph for a Wedding Anniversary surprise. From the very warm telephone chat with Avishek on reception it was clear that this hotel prided itself on customer service.
reviews.title: Bargain rate B&B
If you run a hotel come stay and eat here and see how it should be !!! " A lovely place to eat, a special place to stay " is an
reviews.text: We arrived to a hotel full of Sunday lunchers and it all looked so tempting that we took Sunday lunch at £29.50 per head (everything has a discretionary service charge on top) and so a Pimms at £7.15 was hardly a bargain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the £85 B&B rate which included a half bottle of Champagne (now £95) and even though the hotel expects you to dine overall for the quality of the stay it is still a bargain. We were in room 204 Cartland which looked like that it was newly carpeted and very pleasant even though it didn't have much of a view.
reviews.title: Still our favourite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was taken in the Indian Room and options included kippers at a supplement.
reviews.title: An excellent Experience
